cars.summary: The Volvo 1800 was offered for sale between 1961-1972, this however, is an end of production configuration offered in 1973. This example is a no run no drive vehicle and will require a full engine rebuild or replacement.
A striking resemblance to the Chevrolet 3100 and you would be right as both cars stepped off the same assembly line. This a running and driving vehicle requiring paint and minor body work.
The entry level Packard in 1953 however the design has surely stood the test of time. This car is a running but no drive with major rust in floorboard.
The not so little brother to the iconic Chevelle, this car has begun to surge in popularity in the last decade. Wheels and tires not included but it is a running and driving vehicle.
You either love them or you hate them. This '57 Beetle is mechinacally sound and while the patina is finished, there is a significant amount of rust in the floorboards.
This 280Z requires a full engine rebuild after overheating. Diagnosis led to a faulty oil collection tube which can be replaced. The body however on this vehicle is in immaculate condition.
